
A careless admin leaked half of their RSA private key. Can you recover the message below, encrypted with their exposed key? Ciphertext: 63329332769759987333857492823532384886995927611383671399679936864474109070306589438382267300249746947063364856171646462487266762281436589332222909948010


The flag format is flag{...}
n=10083153133697018804896438712761747078686774753990210278122265348058044630326657611994649066900471939499406931928949704025176234044848783406106662747382349, e=283727997271768768367837704955187618685999463420666589400892927946992493746416597942252795674920795938831440083802699829149153319520375884850281222325419, partial_p=16248908847148634073

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{t6hpnr3t}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 63329332769759987333857492823532384886995927611383671399679936864474109070306589438382267300249746947063364856171646462487266762281436589332222909948010
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10083153133697018804896438712761747078686774753990210278122265348058044630326657611994649066900471939499406931928949704025176234044848783406106662747382349, e=283727997271768768367837704955187618685999463420666589400892927946992493746416597942252795674920795938831440083802699829149153319520375884850281222325419, partial_p=16248908847148634073
extra_info: p=101996053922576681229399723890094647766009934297152834119340462574452672785809, q=98858267020319765757994679483714555762506451928479871692149328840436898872061, Ï†(n)=10083153133697018804896438712761747078686774753990210278122265348058044630326456757673706170453484545096033122725421187638950601339037293614691773175724480
